questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a Python data type?

choices: Returns the length of a string
Returns the length of a list
Returns the length of a dictionary

questions.question: What is the difference between a list and a tuple in Python?
choices: A list is mutable, while a tuple is immutable.
A list can only contain integers, while a tuple can contain any type of object.
A list can be accessed using square brackets, while a tuple can be accessed using parentheses.
There is no difference between a list and a tuple.
